name: The Bohra Thaal – An Authentic Bohra Cuisine
description: Have You Ever Experienced Dining in a Traditional Bohra Thaal?If not, here’s your chance to be part of an intimate and one-of-a-kind home dining experience. Hosted in the comfort of a warm, welcoming home, this gathering brings together like-minded individuals to share a meal, exchange stories, and turn strangers into friends—all while indulging in the rich flavors of Bohra cuisine.Bohra cuisine originates from the Bohra Muslim community, with roots tracing back to Yemen before flourishing in India. Over the centuries, it has evolved into a delightful fusion of Middle Eastern, Mughlai, Gujarati, and Maharashtrian flavors, reflecting a legacy of migration, trade, and cultural influences.What makes Bohra dining truly special is its communal style—meals are served in a giant "Thaal", where 4 to 6 guests dine together, fostering a deep sense of connection, warmth, and tradition.From Finance to Flavours: My Journey into Bohra CuisineAs a Chartered Accountant, I built a career in finance, working with esteemed firms like Avendus and ASK. While finance was my profession, my true passion lay in cooking.Back in Mumbai, my home-cooked meals were always a highlight among friends and colleagues. After relocating to Bengaluru six months ago, I finally decided to follow my culinary dream, giving birth to The Bohra Thaal—a heartfelt endeavor to bring the authentic Bohra "Thaal" experience to Namma Bengaluru.Now, we invite you to be part of this journey and savor a 9-course Bohra feast—served with love, straight from our home to your plate.What to Expect?🍽️ Indulge in an authentic 9-course Bohra feast🍛 Dine the traditional way—sharing a giant Thaal with 4 to 6 guests🏡 Experience the warmth of home-style communal dining⏳ Pre-booking closes 2 days in advance"The nourishment of the body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others." — Hazrat Ali

name: Didgeridoo Sound Healing + Breathwork
description: Sound Bath with Brandon Colaco : A Didgeridoo Healing ExperienceDrift into a deep, immersive soundscape where breath becomes rhythm and ancient frequencies awaken the body and mind.Join us for a powerful sound bath led by Brandon Colaco, one of India’s leading didgeridoo artists. This experience begins with gentle stretching and breathwork, grounding the body and preparing you to fully receive the healing vibrations of the didgeridoo. You’ll then rest in Shavasana for an extended sound journey , followed by a guided integration circle to close.What to Expect:	•	A 20-minute movement + breathwork session to release tension and prepare for the healing sound bath - led by Vivek	•	A 50-minute didgeridoo sound immersion led by Brandon Colaco	•	Integration and sharing circle to complete the session with grounding and reflectionBenefits:The didgeridoo is one of the world’s oldest instruments, traditionally used by the Aboriginal people of Australia. Its infrasonic frequencies (below the range of human hearing) create deep, cellular-level vibrations that promote:	•	Physical healing: reduce inflammation, relieve pain, and support tissue repair	•	Mental clarity: enhance focus, creativity, and emotional balance	•	Spiritual insight: support lucid dreaming, deep rest, and inner stillness	•	Sleep regulation and nervous system resetBrandon’s fusion of traditional didgeridoo with Konnakol rhythms from South India creates a unique, deeply resonant sound experience unlike any other. With over 15 years of experience and a presence on global stages from Europe and being features in Rolling Stone India/Australia, his sound immersions are known to be transformative.This is more than a sound bath—it’s a healing experience for body, mind, and spirit.

name: Rafoo:Bengaluru Mending Beyond Fabric Workshop
description: In this reflective hands-on workshop, we’ll engage with fabric as a way to explore ideas of rupture, repair, and resilience. Through processes like cutting, stitching, and layering, participants will be invited to work with cloth as a surface for personal expression and quiet transformation Rather than aiming for perfection, we’ll embrace irregular threads, raw edges, and visible mends as part of the story. Together, we’ll explore what it means to tend to what feels broken, in fabric, and perhaps within or around us.All materials will be provided. However if you have a piece of clothing or fabric you’d like to mend or embellish, feel free to bring it along. No prior stitching experience needed

name: Aprisio 'Back In Time Rock Experience'
description: Aprisio presents the 'Back In Time Rock Experience'.Relive the soundtrack of your youth. Step into a night that’s not just about music — it’s about memories, moods, and moments that defined who we were. Join us as we go 'Back In Time' with the greatest hits of the 70s, 80s, and mid 90s — a time when rock wasn’t just a genre, it was an identity. This isn’t just another rock gig. At Aprisio, every element is thoughtfully curated and designed for our 40+ community.This immersive evening is crafted for those who want to not just hear the music, but feel it — in their bones, their stories, their laughter, and their conversations.What’s In Store:Live Band PerformanceA high energy rock band - Soul Smoke - playing classics from Dire Straits, Bon Jovi, Fleetwood Mac, Pink Floyd, Queen, Eagles, and more.The Story Behind the Songs​Between sets, enjoy short interludes where a MC unravels the stories, cultural impact, and memories behind some of your favourite tracks.Vinyl Memory Lounge​Explore a pop-up installation of iconic vinyl covers and song trivia. Share your own memories on our retro message wall.Make Your Own Mixtape​Curate a personal playlist from a printed catalog of songs — swap stories with fellow guests about your teenage rock anthems.Band Tees​Come dressed in your favourite band T-shirt. We are giving prizes for the best vintage look!Event Details🗓️ Date: Sunday, 1st June​📍 Venue: Downtown Pub (Basement), Residency Road​🕖 Time: 7 pm onwards​🎟️ Tickets: Rs. 2,500 per person plus 18% GST. The ticket includes coupons worth Rs. 1,000 redeemable against food & beverages at the venue.Tickets are required for all guests over the age of 8.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21 as per the Karnataka Excise rules.

name: Haal Khayal: What's the language of our souls?
description: Haal Khayal: What's the language of our souls?A workshop to honor our feelings, thoughts and emotions and find a non-verbal language to express them through the mediums of threads and textiles.In this workshop, we will focus on our moods and feelings, using stitching- a rhythmic and meditative tool to process, reflect, and express our emotional landscapes. Through the act of making marks on fabric, participants will explore how simple, repetitive stitches can convey complex emotions, transforming inner feelings into tangible, creative expressions.This is a shorter, more affordable version of our full-length workshops, designed to be accessible to a wider audience. Basic materials will be provided. If you’d like to bring your own fabric or threads to make the experience more personal, you’re welcome to do so. No prior stitching experience needed.Please Note: All proceeds from this workshop go toward supporting and sustaining Rafooghar's community space in New Delhi where women who live on the margins gather every Sunday for rest, leisure, and emotional repairDesigned and facilitated by Rafooghar-the house that mendsOrganized by The Drawing Room ClubSpace courtesy: Cafe ZubaanJoin The Drawing Room Club here:https://chat.whatsapp.com/Jl5TUSVgxBU9ZOI1oMMYO4

name: Anime Pop-Up @ Bento Bento
description: Bento Bento Presents: An Anime-Inspired Culinary Experience14th & 15th June | 12:30–3:00 PM, 7:00–10:00 PMBento Bento is back with a new celebration of food and fandom — this time diving into the vibrant and flavourful world of anime.Inspired by iconic scenes and comfort meals from some of Japan’s most beloved anime series, this curated pop-up brings to life dishes that fans have seen on screen and long wondered about. With past tributes to Studio Ghibli and Midnight Diner, Bento Bento now takes a fresh turn towards the fast-paced, heartfelt, and imaginative food culture of anime.Chef Anumitra, whose culinary roots are shaped in part by her time in Japan, brings a deep respect for authenticity while channeling the visual flair and nostalgia that these shows evoke. Whether you’re a long-time anime fan or a curious food lover, Bento Bento invites you to taste the flavours of your favourite shows.Come hungry. Leave nostalgic. THE MENUSweets & SnacksDorayaki – Doraemon Soft, fluffy pancakes filled with sweet red bean paste. This is Doraemon’s favorite snack — a simple, sweet treat with a hint of nostalgia.Dango – Naruto Chewy rice dumplings on skewers, glazed with sweet soy sauce. Often eaten during festivals, dango is a symbol of joy and camaraderie.Savoury DishesOnigiri (Single) – Demon Slayer Triangular rice balls wrapped in seaweed and filled with surprises like tangy pickled plum or seasoned vegetables — a staple in bento boxes and beloved by anime heroes on the go.Gyoza – Food Wars Pan-seared Japanese dumplings with a juicy, seasoned filling. These dumplings are ubiquitous in Food Wars' competitions, and here they’re served crisp with a dipping sauce.Nikuman – Haikyuu!! Fluffy steamed buns filled with savoury pork. This hearty snack is a popular reward after volleyball practice scenes in Haikyuu!!, and perfect for a quick burst of energy.MealsRamen – Naruto A steaming bowl of noodles in rich broth, topped with marinated egg, pork, and greens. This dish is practically a co-star in Naruto, where Ichiraku Ramen is a frequent backdrop.Katsudon – Yuri on Ice, My Hero Academia A comforting bowl of rice topped with crispy pork cutlet, soft scrambled egg, and sweet-salty sauce. Katsudon is often portrayed as a dish of encouragement and reward in anime.Chicken Karaage Bento Juicy, marinated fried chicken served with rice and pickles — this Japanese-style fried chicken bento is crunchy, satisfying, and a lunchbox favorite.Brinjal with Ponzu Bento A vegetarian bento featuring grilled or roasted brinjal dressed in a tangy ponzu sauce. Balanced, light, and packed with umami.Vegetarian variations are available upon request.

name: Starry Nights - Art | Music | Food
description: Join us on a beautiful rooftop as the Bangalore breeze sets the mood for a chill, art-filled night. For just ₹450, you’ll get access to a variety of DIY art activity options — whether you’re into painting, crafts, or just exploring something new, we’ve got you covered. No experience needed — just come as you are.What to expect:Multiple art stations with all materials providedA surprise food stall serving up delicious treats (available for purchase)Curated music that inspires and upliftsCozy, creative vibes and a stunning rooftop settingWhether you're planning a relaxed evening with friends or looking to try something different on your own, Starry Nights is the perfect alternative to the usual cafe or bar scene. Limited spots available — book now and make your weekend sparkle!Terms and ConditionsTicket Requirement: All attendees aged 4 and above must hold a valid ticket to enter the event.Booking Fee: The ticket price includes a booking fee of ₹450, which is fully redeemable against art and craft activities at the event.Photography & Videography: Photos and videos taken during the event may be used for social media and promotional purposes. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team upon arrival.Cancellations & Refunds: Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellations or no-shows.Weather Contingency: In case of rain, the event will either be moved to indoors or cancelled. If cancelled, a full refund will be processed.Food Policy: Outside food is not allowed at the venue.Parking: Parking is available in the vicinity of the venue at the vehicle owner's risk. Please note, valet service is not available.

name: Sarangi Recital with Ustaad Dilshad Khan | Baithak
description: Note: this time, Baithak will be held on a Sunday morning.About Courtyard BaithakThe Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the ArtistUstaad Dilshad Khan is a tenth-generation Sarangi player from the renowned Sikar Gharana of Rajasthan. Trained under his grandfather, father, and later the legendary Ustad Sultan Khan Sahab, Dilshad has emerged as one of the foremost torchbearers of the Sarangi today.A celebrated soloist and collaborator, he has performed globally with maestros like Ustad Zakir Hussain and Pt. Birju Maharaj, and his music features in over 500 Bollywood films including Devdas and Dangal. He is also a recipient of the prestigious Aga Khan Music Award (2022).With deep roots in tradition and a global reach, Dilshad Khan brings the timeless voice of the Sarangi to a new generation of listeners.This event is supported by Samagata Foundation.Terms and Conditions1. The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.2. No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.3. Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.4. Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.5. Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.6. Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.7. Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.8. In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: Brigade road heritage walk
description: Join us as we revive our cherished walks through the historic Cantonment this year. Step back in time as we trace the origins of this storied district once the heart of colonial Bangalore.On this journey we will explore a magnificent church that has stood the test of time pay homage at a solemn war memorial and admire a beautifully restored heritage structure. Along the way we will encounter stately British-era government buildings a statue of a notable foreigner and a road steeped in its own fascinating history.Every corner of the Cantonment whispers tales of its past—stories of soldiers administrators and the many communities that shaped this unique enclave. Join us as we rediscover its enduring legacy one step at a time.

name: The German Family Brunch + Kid's Workshop at Coro
description: 🇩🇪 The German Family Brunch + Kid's Workshop at CoroThis June, bring the whole family to Coro for a cozy German-style Sunday brunch like no other — with delicious food for you, and a playful, cultural workshop for the little ones!Hosted by German BrezelHaus, this experience blends flavor, tradition, and family bonding in one warm setting.🥨 What's on the Brunch Buffet?Enjoy a hearty spread of authentic German favorites:Originalbuttery Brezel (pretzel)Cheese pretzels (veg & chicken)Baker-style German pasta casserole (veg)Roasted chicken with sautéed vegetablesGarlic bread, spring mix salad with balsamicPocket Berliners – chocolate ganache & lemon cream filledEggless marble cakeFresh lemonade🎨 For the Kids – A Workshop to Remember!While parents feast, the kids (age 8 & below) join Hannah from German BrezelHaus for a magical hands-on workshop:🕰️ Craft your own German cuckoo clock 🎨 Design a German flag to take homeAdd a little piece of Germany to your kid’s room!The workshop starts at 11:00 AM — giving you the perfect time to relax and enjoy your brunch while your child gets creative.Pricing:Combo: 1 Adult + 1 Kid (age ≤ 8) Veg: ₹1400/ Non-Veg: ₹1550Additional AdultVeg: ₹900 / Non-Veg: ₹1000Additional Kid: ₹700 (includes workshop + buffet)Venue: Coro, BengaluruDate: 21st June 2025Time: Workshop starts at 11 AM onwardSeats are limited — bring your appetite, your family, and your curiosity. Let’s make Sundays a little more German, right here in Bengaluru 🇩🇪 Guten Appetit
